Posts.Content: Good luck KW, you certainly will be welcomed to the other side !!!. Glad you found this site before your RP, it does have lots of good information that will help you along the way. Let us know how you are doing. Cheers, Curt

Posts.Title: Surgery Tomorrow

Posts.Content: Thanks for the inputs.The doctor said this time the biopsy will be done in the hospital with antibiotic but i still worry about the infection. I wonder if there is a way to do the biopsy with less chance to get an infection. Such as perineum instead of through the rectum
Posts.Title: Should I have another biopsy

Posts.Content: I had a prostate biopsy 3 years ago. It's negative. The biopsy gave me an infection(sepsis).I had a DNA methylation over a year ago because my psa was 8 at that point. It was positive at the right apex. Right After that I had a MRI that was negative. A few weeks ago. I had another PSA test and it's 11. The doctor wants to do another biopsy at the apex where DNA methylation shows positive. Should I have another biopsy. I worry to get another infection from the biopsy. Thanks.

Posts.Title: Should I have another biopsy

Posts.Content: I also had robotic surgery and had my lymph nodes removed and checked for cancer, no problem at all with any of that. Having your lymph nodes checked for cancer will further confirm if you have had any cancer spread, and from what my surgeon told me that removing them has no side effects or consequences. Once I knew I had cancer, I wanted everyone to know, I even posted on my Facebook page. Maybe I was looking for a little sympathy but I have used this to help educate everyone to this horrible disease which is mostly overlooked. Cheers, Curt

Posts.Title: Lymph node removal with robotic surgery?

Posts.Content: I had my RP over one year ago and I would like to revisit with you, my path to the use of Trimix for those of you that might benefit from it. My RP went well, my Uro was also my Surgeon and I am very pleased with my outcome. The only part that I would change would be my education to dealing with the typical ED issues that most have after RP. I wish I knew early on what I know now about ED rehab and this is my attempt to try and help my fellow PC brothers to maybe make earlier decisions. It seems that most Uro's and surgeons are not very open about ED rehab and don't really talk about it. They don't seem to understand how important it is in keeping our male sexuality intact. My Uro did not even bring ED rehab up until I started asking questions because of the information I was starting to get from these very important sites I have gotten involved with. After telling him about my concerns, he finally gave me some ED Drug samples and said to take one every week to help with rehab. I also asked him about a VED and he said that might help also. I ended up purchasing a VED and used it for a while but found it to be quit a process to use and not much fun. In my readings I was hearing, "use it or lose it" !!!! I was over six months out from my RP and had an appointment with my Uro when I brought up the idea of injections, nothing else was working. I told him how I felt and that I wanted to try that approach and he said ok. He wanted me to make another appointment and then come in for a trial injection to see how it worked. The next week, I went in and he explained the procedure, he injected a small amount of trimix to see how I reacted and WoW, it worked !!!! I was elated at the idea of actually being back in control of my ability to have sex again and the rehab qualities that this might bring me. I purchased 5 syringes from my Uro with 1 cc of trimix in each one. While reading on the boards, I could see that 1 cc of trimix could send you off to the ER, I have no idea why he would prescribe such a large starting dose !! I think the boards really saved me from this. The small dose my Uro gave me in his office was around .2 cc and I did have a nice reaction that lasted about an hour. I decided to start myself at .25 cc and work my way up from there till I had about a 2 hour reaction which is really good for sex and rehab. The syringes he gave me were 5 cc and had big needles. Also because of what I had been reading, I decided to get .5 cc syringes with 30 gauge needles. The smaller size syringes gave me really accurate control of my dose and the small needles totally eliminated any pinch feeling I was getting from the larger needles. No pain and accurate control of your dose is really a good thing. I slowly worked my way up to .5 cc keeping track of my dose, date and site of the injection. I was injecting 3 times per week and unfortunatley did not have a partner to try this out on so I just chocked it up to rehab. i have now been using trimix since December, had great sex with a gal 4 times, have proven to myself that having a 2 hr woody can be very productive having sex and for its physical rehab qualities. If I was to do this all over again, I would get started on trimix as soon as possible after RP, would start out with the proper syringe needle combination for accurate control of dose and eliminating any pain from injection and would inject 3 times per week with or without a sex partner. You might need to challenge your Doctor about all this and take control !!! This is not at all a mystery to me anymore and it was in the beginning. From my personal experience and from everything I am reading, there is nothing wrong with this approach, in fact, it should be the standard, not the exception. You should not have to pull this info out of your Doctor nor feel funny asking about it. Be forward, be strong and take control !! For us guy's, this is a very big mental and physical challenge that we all need to take control of and it can be done. Hope this helps some of you make the decision to get with it, you have nothing to loose other than your own sexual well being which was really important to me. Cheers, and here's to harder days ahead for you that jump on to the Trimix wagon.

AgeInfo.Phrase: decided to start myself at  25 cc and work my way

Posts.Title: My Path from RP, ED to using Trimix

Posts.Content: Hi Race- I use a 30 g with no bruising problems, I am not sure why doc's don't help us out a little more with this, I guess they are not sticking themselves in the dick so they don't really understand The smaller needle seems to work just fine with most guy's, I have read many great positive comments and that is why I changed. How long is your needle ?? Curt
Posts.Signature: 5/05- PSA 2.008 12/08- PSA 2.87 2/11- PSA 4.357 3/11- 12 needle biopcy performed with cancer detected in only 1 core with a Gleason Score of 3+3, 6/11-Robotic Prostatectomy performed, Path report showed tumor size 1cc stage pT2c with no signs of cancer ouside the prostate 9/11 PSA .060 11/11 PSA .19 11/24/11 Started Avodart for 22 days 12/16/12 PSA .154 3/12/12 PSA .157 Age 60
Posts.Title: My Path from RP, ED to using Trimix

Posts.Content: Originally Posted by Race I'm glad to hear some discussion about Trimix. My urologist/surgeon offered the injections when I asked about ED about 4 months after surgery. The pills were not doing much for me. I have been using it for the last 4 months. My urologist did not recommend using more than twice a week. The dosage that works for me is about 0.10 cc. I have been slowly improving in the ED department. The pills (viagra or cialis) will work for me about half the time lately. I've had one successful intercourse with no help at all. Having the Trimix to go to is a real good thing. (But never double up with the pills). Hi Race- Yes, your are correct, Trimix is really good for rehab and should be used as soon as possible after RP if pills are not working. The problem I see is that some Uro's are not taking care of the ED and ED rehab quickly enough. An RP patient should be on an agressive ED rehab program as soon as physically possible, usually no longer than 30 days would be my guess, everyone will be a little different. Get Serious, The sooner the better for ED rehab, don't wait !!!!! Curt
Posts.Signature: 5/05- PSA 2.008 12/08- PSA 2.87 2/11- PSA 4.357 3/11- 12 needle biopcy performed with cancer detected in only 1 core with a Gleason Score of 3+3, 6/11-Robotic Prostatectomy performed, Path report showed tumor size 1cc stage pT2c with no signs of cancer ouside the prostate 9/11 PSA .060 11/11 PSA .19 11/24/11 Started Avodart for 22 days 12/16/12 PSA .154 3/12/12 PSA .157 Age 60
Posts.Title: My Path from RP, ED to using Trimix

Posts.Content: Hi Davidhp- I was also 60 when I found out I had PC. I also had a raise in my PSA over a years period and that triggered my biopsy which I had done right away. Out of 12 core samples, they found 1 little trace of cancer. I had my robotic RP done just a little over a year ago. The key is catching this thing early and it looks like you are on the right track for that. My surgery went well and I am hoping for a long life ahead of me. Keep plugging away and let us know how you are doing. These forums are great. Any questions, just ask away and there are people that will jump in and help. Good luck with your biopsy, it seems worse than it really sounds and is over very quickly. Cheers, Curt

Posts.Title: Getting Biopsy in Two Weeks

Posts.Content: 6 months ago, I started on trimix and it took .5 cc to work well. Last night, I decided to try .3 and see what would happen and to my surprise, it worked just as well seems like my rehab is working !!! I will try .25 next time. Now my little bottle will last twice as long, guess I better find me some more babes for more rehab !!!! Cheers everyone. Curt

Posts.Title: Getting Biopsy in Two Weeks

Posts.Content: Ok, I am going to travel to the Philippines to visit a new girl that I might eventually bring back to the US to live with me How do I travel with trimix so it stays cold for an extended period of time. I live in Seattle and the flight is really long and by the time I find a hotel in Manila and get settled in, it might be close to 2 days. I really need the trimix to be ok, this will be my only opportunity to have an intimate relationship with my girl before I would try and start the long process to bring her back to me in the US. I need a plan, any help with ideas would be greatly appreciated. Thanks, Curt
